title: The great gatsby fonts
content:
Can anyone tell me what the two fotns are that are used for the original Great Gatsby cover? The one with the eyes overlooking the amusement park. Thanks!

 [‹ type id again – for me: the first time!](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/typophile.com/node/38028 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can you identify this font please? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/typophile.com/node/38035 "Go to next forum topic")
author: erin4

comments.content:
Most likely hand-drawn (the ’G’s are different widths). There might be something out there that looks similar though.

- Lex

You might like [Handle Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/handle_old_style/), [Belwe](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/belwe_std/) or [Trieste](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/trieste_ot/).

For the “The”, [Bookman Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016160516/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085) has a ’Th’ ligature that comes close.
